name: HD 156411
scenarioDescription:
The HD 156411 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 156411 is a star with 1.25 times the mass of the Sun, and 2.16 times its radius. It is located 185.78 light years away from the solar system.

HD 156411 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 156411 system


HD 156411 b

HD 156411 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.88 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 156411 b is 235.32 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 156411 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 156411, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
